result.execSummary:
The defendant Terence Delynn Maclin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 4/12/2017, or serve 20 days in the House of Correction.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, with credit for 110 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

F&CCommitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
20 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Both parties are ready to proceed. Case passed.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Anne Aileen Devitt.   Student Intern Katherine Ginsberg under the supervision of Attorney Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsi
Case set for jury trial, however, for reasons stated on the record, the State and Defense request an adjournment of the jury trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion in limine, received and filed.
Defendant's proposed jury instructions received and filed.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for jury trial. Parties are ready to proceed, however, previous clerk did not order a juror panel for this morning, therefore, court ordered jury trial to begin at 1:30pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terence Delynn Maclin in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
